Detailed Description

A named value, with optional subattributes.

Use the Waypoint::addAttribute(const String &name, const String &value) to create and add an attribute to a waypoint.

Or use Attribute::create(const String &name, const Variant &value) to create an attribute and Waypoint::addAttribute(Attribute *attribute) to add the attribute to a waypoint.

Optionally use addSubattribute() to add one or more subattributes to an attribute. It is also possible to add subattributes to a subattribute.

See Also
Waypoint class

Attribute* Chronicle::Attribute::clone ( ) const

Returns a copy of the attribute.

All subattributes are also copied.

See Also
AttributeList::clone()
static Attribute* Chronicle::Attribute::create ( const String &  name,
const Variant &  value = Variant() 
)
static

Creates an attribute with a name and value.

Optionally add subattributes using addSubattribute().

Warning
The caller assumes ownership of the attribute until the attribute is added to a waypoint by calling Waypoint::addAttribute(Attribute *attribute).
Parameters
nameThe attribute name.
valueThe attribute value.
Returns
An Attribute instance.
void Chronicle::Attribute::destroy ( )

Destroys the attribute.

Warning
Do not destroy an attribute that has been added to a waypoint.
bool Chronicle::Attribute::hasSubattributes ( ) const

Returns true if this attribute has subattributes, otherwise false.

void Chronicle::Attribute::setName ( const String &  name)

Sets the attribute name.

The name is initially set when the attribute is constructed, but the name can be changed afterwards.

Parameters
nameThe attribute name.
See Also

void Chronicle::Attribute::setValue ( const Variant &  value)

Sets the attribute value.

The value is initially set when the attribute is constructed, but the value can be changed afterwards.

Parameters
valueThe attribute value.
See Also
value()
AttributeList* Chronicle::Attribute::subattributes ( ) const
inline

Returns the collection of subattributes for this attribute.

Warning
The return value is NULL if there are no subattributes.
Do not attempt to use the collection after the owner waypoint has been passed to the Facade, or after the attribute itself has been destroyed.
Returns
A pointer to the attribute list.
See Also
hasSubattributes(), addSubattribute()
